alert.note: Alert for Calvert; Charles; St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 7:30PM EDT until July 29 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... St. Marys County in southern Maryland... Southeastern Calvert County in southern Maryland... South central Charles County in southern Maryland... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 730 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hollywood to near Leonardtown to 6 miles southeast of Popes Creek, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Lexington Park, Chesapeake Ranch Estates, Leonardtown, Cuckold Creek, Saint Marys City, Greenwell State Park, Saint Leonard Creek, Saint Clements Bay, Town Creek, Wicomico River, White Point Beach, California, Lusby, Patuxent River Naval Air Station, Hollywood, Wicomico, Drum Point, Mechanicsville, Charlotte Hall and Cobb Island. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
